Pre-Game Insights: India’s batting unit has performed way below par in the series, failing to chase down par totals in two consecutive ODIs.
Sri Lanka’s spin bowling attack has been effective, with the likes of Jeffrey Vandersay, Dunith Wellalage, the captain Charith Asalanka, and Akila Dananjaya picking up the bulk of the wickets.
Rohit Sharma, the India captain, has performed well, while the rest of the Indian batting lineup has struggled.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The average first inning score of 226 in ODI cricket at this venue could end up being very difficult to chase down for either Sri Lanka or India in the series decider.
A win in the third match will give Sri Lanka their first bilateral ODI series triumph over India in 27 years.
